DataElement.preferredName: Head and Neck Tumor Origin Location Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the site of origin of a head and neck tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Head and Neck Neoplasm Origin Anatomic Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the anatomic site of origin of a benign or malignant neoplasm affecting one of the following areas: base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Head and Neck Head and Neck Neoplasm
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: For oncology, area of the body generally construed to comprise base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.:A benign or malignant neoplasm affecting one of the following areas: base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

Concepts.definition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the anatomic structures of the head and neck region.  Representative examples of benign neoplasms include salivary gland pleomorphic adenoma and nasal cavity papilloma.  Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include oral cavity squamous cell carcinoma, laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma, and salivary gland carcinoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: The place where something begins or comes from in either the sense of a physical location or a metaphysical source.:Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: The place where something begins or comes from in either the sense of a physical location or a metaphysical source.
Named locations of or within the body.
